entry.title: [ios] Fix crash when replacing SetUpList MagicStack modules
entry.content:
This change fixes an issue when the SetUpList MagicStack module gets

replaced (with the "All Done" module, for example). The code involves

an array of indexes. When getting the last index and then removing it,

the mistake was that the retrieved index is an index into the

arrangedSubviews array, and not an index into the array of indexes. It

was just easier to use removeLastObject to remove the index from the

array since we alerady know it is the last one.



This crash occurs when the index of the last SetUpList module in the

MagicStack is greater than the number of SetUpList modules. So if there

is one SetUpList module and it is behind the MVTs, it will crash when

the user completes whichever item is left.



Fixed: 1496279

Change-Id: I72a47f73cc04b2679d06cff1acb305c2d20dcd2c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4984527

entry.content:
Profile button should be able to overflow in responsive mode.

When the button is activated it should pop out since the bubble need

to anchor to the button. kToolbarAvatarBubbleElementId is used for

popping out the button when it's shown and end the pop out when

it's closed.

entry.title: [image search] Fix the disappearing focus traversal in launcher search
entry.content:
When a image search result is shown in the launcher, the focus

disappears if we move it down from the close button. This is because

the ImagePreviewView is a image button and is a candidate to be

focused. Fix that by setting the focus behavior to accessible only.

entry.title: FSA: Make LockHandle own its parent LockHandle
entry.content:
This is a refactor in preparation to implement BFCache logic for

FileSystemAccessLockManager. There should be no behavioral change.



In the next CL, Locks will create a LockHandle per Render Frame Host. To

do this, a Lock and its ancestor Locks will need to create a new

LockHandle for each RFH.



This enables that change by recursively creating LockHandles up the

ancestor chain each time a LockHandle is created.

entry.title: Overlay fullscreen DRM default black optimization
entry.content:
The default for a region with no plane intersection is black on for

DRM.[0]



"Note that all the property extensions described here apply either to

the plane or the CRTC (e.g. for the background color, which currently

is not exposed and assumed to be black)."



We can use this special case to optimize the solid black bars common

to video and other fullscreen situations.[1]





[0] https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/gpu/drm-kms.html#plane-composition-properties



[1]

https://docs.google.com/document/d/10CsvEixN71AfmKWi3hEmJFz8qSMJhkppG-bKZOJ2OAU/edit



[2] https://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/dri-devel/2023-January/385098.html

entry.title: Reland "Correct and efficient handling of SolidColorScrollbarLayer color change""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 716a958aefa59e19c5fb2c34e2e2da56250c3717.



Uninitialized cc::FakeScrollbar::solid_color_ is fixed.



Original change's description:

> [Gardener] Revert "Correct and efficient handling of SolidColorScrollbarLayer color change"

>

> This reverts commit 16692dad3c04e0acbbb22c1ae9c758c83f3d20d4.

>

> Reason for revert: Change is causing the following tests to fail:

> - ScrollbarDisplayItemTest.HorizontalSolidColorScrollbar

> - ScrollbarDisplayItemTest.VerticalSolidColorScrollbar

> Example build:

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/39242/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > Correct and efficient handling of SolidColorScrollbarLayer color change

> >

> > - Now a SolidColorScrollbarLayer can change color without recreating

> > the scrollbar, which reduces cost.

> > - When color changes, ensure SolidColorScrollbarLayer::SetColor() is

> > called.

> >

> > Also remove LayerTreeSettings::solid_color_scrollbar_color. It was for

> > the default color of the composited solid color scrollbars, and was

> > duplicate with the default color for non-composited solid color

> > scrollbars. Now let blink::ScrollbarThemeOverlayMobile manage the

> > default color for both overlay and non-overlay scrollbars.

> >

> > Also move the WebView scrollbar hiding logic into

> > SolidColorScrollbarLayer::SetColor(), which make it easy to apply the

> > logic to the root scrollbars only.

> >

> > Bug: 1490799

> > Change-Id: Ifd2118268b8bc6cb6b789045d800582a695c6616

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4968601

> > Commit-Queue: Xianzhu Wang

> > Reviewed-by: Vladimir Levin

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1216214}

entry.title: Dismiss customize chrome IPH only when navigation happens from active tab
entry.content:
There is an edge case where we are closing customize chrome on a

background navigation that is causing hovercards to be closed.

Previously this was causing a crash issue due to reentrancy where

thumbnail image was invalidated within TabHoverCardThumbnailObserver

during the Observe call. However, that has been fixed but we still want

to ensure we close the IPH only when the navigation happens on the

active tab. This is consistent with the behavior for a tab that is

created in the background. That works since the browser instance is

nullptr when the navigation is triggered.



Bug: 1353340

entry.title: [EditContext] Disable execCommand and related APIs
entry.content:
document.execCommand and related commands (queryCommandValue,

queryCommandState, queryCommandEnabled, queryCommandIndeterm) do not

work in a way that makes sense with EditContext. They do not fire

beforeinput, which EditContext depends on, and they modify the DOM

directly rather than going through EditContext, which will cause the

editor view implemented in the DOM to become out of sync with the

editor model whose state is in the EditContext.



Furthermore execCommand is deprecated and non-interoperable in many

cases.



Given these factors, in this CL make execCommand a no-op when

an EditContext-based Editing Host has focus, and make all the

related query commands return false/null values. This change is

limited to command types that are conditionally enabled based on

whether an Editing Host has focus. Command types that are

unconditionally enabled (such as "copy") are not affected.



See also https://github.com/w3c/edit-context/issues/71



Bug: 999184

Change-Id: I91cc5c3d043715c0753e800f2fae2cd8fe7870d3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4975435

Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

Commit-Queue: Dan Clark

entry.title: Revert "[wptrunner] Translate TestExpectations and baselines to metadata"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 75c6595ba8a9bceab2b4e718f0a81f73a33b923b.



Reason for revert:

This CL changed which baselines `//BUILD.gn` isolates, which causes

some baseline mismatches:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac12-arm64-rel-tests/14253/overview



Original change's description:

> [wptrunner] Translate TestExpectations and baselines to metadata

>

> This change switches wptrunner from reading expectations from `.ini`

> metadata files to reading them from existing TestExpectation lines and

> `*-expected.txt`. This is done by patching `testloader.TestLoader`,

> which generates (approximately) equivalent `.ini` syntax trees entirely

> in memory, at runtime.

>

> To support [1], errors messages in baselines are also loaded into

> `expected-fail-message` keys to be checked wptrunner-side by

> Chrome-specific executors.

>

> Also, remove the `(INTERNAL|EXTERNAL)-*` wptrunner statuses, as `mozlog`

> will refuse to log them [2].

>

> [1]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/rfcs/pull/165

> [2]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/59cd10c8/tools/third_party_modified/mozlog/mozlog/logtypes.py#L187-L217

entry.title: [Extensions] Toggle registered user scripts according to dev mode
entry.content:
The userScripts API is gated on the user being in developer mode. If

the user exits developer mode, any registered user scripts should no

longer run.



Add support for disabling and re-enabling these user scripts when the

user enters or exits dev mode. Note that this deliberately does *not*

remove the scripts from the storage in

`ExtensionUserScriptLoader::loaded_dynamic_scripts_` and only removes

them from the base `UserScriptLoader` (which notifies all renderers

appropriately). This ensures that when subsequent updates and writes

occur, the user scripts are still correctly persisted in the database

and makes re-enabling them simple.



A future CL will properly initialize the enabled state of user scripts

on browser startup and ExtensionUserScriptLoader initialization.

entry.title: Fix AnchoredNudgeData's "DanglingUntriaged" anchor_view pointer
entry.content:
Use a view tracker to observe the nudge's anchor view. This will return

a null pointer if the view was deleted before the data was consumed by

the nudge manager.



A new field `is_anchored` was added to detect invalid states. If

`is_anchored` is true but `anchor_view` is null then we can return

early. `anchor_view` may be null when the nudge shows on its default

location.



A function `SetAnchorView` was added to keep `anchor_view` private.

Exposing it through this function ensures the anchor view that was

provided is properly being tracked and `is_anchored` is up to date.



more context in:

go/nudge-data-dangling-ptr



Change-Id: I3cb70302ea5ff88cd7983f9e0a31636a89260522

Bug: b:307628144

entry.title: Refactor privacy_math to do randomized response
entry.content:
This CL does a few things:

1. Moves most randomized response logic out of the storage delegate

2. Moves RandomizedResponseData into privacy_math

3. Computes channel capacity at the same time as doing randomized

response. This causes a bit of extra work in the case where channel

capacity is exceeded, but it simplifies the interface and may end up

being needed down the line anyway in case we stop unconditionally

failing when channel capacity is exceeded.

4. Augments the k-combination helper function to work at extreme values

which required some variables to migrate `int` to `int64_t`.



Note that the storage delegate still needs to know how to compute the

randomized response rate, as it is needed for computing on-the-fly

`randomized_trigger_rate` when that information is not stored in the db.

This path can likely be removed when we are confident all sources in the

db properly store this.



A follow-up CL will perform randomized response on inputs configured

using TriggerSpecs.



Change-Id: I865cf5a14e5211af45b043a62b5f3d94e31b0380

entry.title: Cellular: Use ICCID to get the network state for disconnected networks
entry.content:
In http://crrev/c/4907733 we started relying on the last connected

cellular network to get the GUID associated with a cellular device.



This led to a regression in case if you have a disconnected

cellular device in a new session, the text messages suppression

doesn't work as there has been no last connected network.



We reintroduce a code path which uses the ICCID to get the network

GUID in addition to the last connected network logic. This fixes

the aforementioned issue by also looking at in-active networks and

and uses network GUID with the matching ICCID.



Bug: b:308104223

Test: chromeos_unittest --gtest_filter=*NetworkSmsHandler*

entry.title: [Gardener] Revert "Correct and efficient handling of SolidColorScrollbarLayer color change"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 16692dad3c04e0acbbb22c1ae9c758c83f3d20d4.



Reason for revert: Change is causing the following tests to fail:

- ScrollbarDisplayItemTest.HorizontalSolidColorScrollbar

- ScrollbarDisplayItemTest.VerticalSolidColorScrollbar

Example build:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/39242/overview



Original change's description:

> Correct and efficient handling of SolidColorScrollbarLayer color change

>

> - Now a SolidColorScrollbarLayer can change color without recreating

> the scrollbar, which reduces cost.

> - When color changes, ensure SolidColorScrollbarLayer::SetColor() is

> called.

>

> Also remove LayerTreeSettings::solid_color_scrollbar_color. It was for

> the default color of the composited solid color scrollbars, and was

> duplicate with the default color for non-composited solid color

> scrollbars. Now let blink::ScrollbarThemeOverlayMobile manage the

> default color for both overlay and non-overlay scrollbars.

>

> Also move the WebView scrollbar hiding logic into

> SolidColorScrollbarLayer::SetColor(), which make it easy to apply the

> logic to the root scrollbars only.

>

entry.title: [autopip] Check embargo in tab helper
entry.content:
When switching tabs while auto-pip is under embargo, the tab helper

doesn't currently notice. As a result, it will allow the site to

open the pip window, which will immediately close once the pip

window notices the embargo. Whether it's visible or not to the user

depends on timing.



This CL causes the tab helper to check the embargo, and not trigger

auto-pip if it's active.

entry.title: [autopip] Prevent flashing autopip when a tab moves between tabstrips
entry.content:
This CL adds two checks to AutoPictureInPictureTabStripObserverHelper:



1) It checks that the current active tab is not kNoTab before updating

the current state. This prevents it from incorrectly assuming it has

become hidden during tabstrip initialization (e.g. when the tab is

first dragged out of a tabstrip).



2) It prevents pure insertion changes from affecting the current state,

as most insertions cause an insertion followed by an immediate

selection change, so updating the state during that intermediate step

causes the tab to think it's hidden when it's not. This can happen when

a tab is first inserted into an existing tab strip (it will first

trigger an "insertion" change without updating the active tab, and then

fire a "selection" change to set the active tab).



Bug: 1496954

Change-Id: I2e218ccf5ef0399fbaffa8235511c8bf9c1e49ea

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4982364

entry.title: Add BackgroundDownloader for Mac
entry.content:
Implement a background CRX downloader for Mac using NSURLSession's

background transfer capabilities. This is intended to work similarly

to the BITS-backed downloader on Windows.



Downloads started by this implementation can continue even if Chrome

is suspended/terminated and can persist through network errors,

reboots, etc.



When the downloader is instantiated, MacOS may notify it of downloads

which were completed in the background. Thus, a cache of unclaimed

downloads is maintained.





Low-Coverage-Reason: TRIVIAL_CHANGE changes to chrome_component_updater_configurator.cc and crx_downloader_factory.cc are trivial

entry.title: [QuickStart][OOBE] Improve cancellation flow
entry.content:
Improve the cancellation flow of QuickStart in OOBE so that it is

properly handled when the user requests via the cancel button, or

when an error occurs.



- Gracefully handle the case when empty WiFi credentials are received.

- Make the NetworkScreen a QuickStartController::UiDelegate so that it

can react to errors arising from the phone side.

- Expand and improve browser tests with some cancellation cases.



Test: Manual testing.



Bug: b/306480433

entry.title: [wptrunner] Translate TestExpectations and baselines to metadata
entry.content:
This change switches wptrunner from reading expectations from `.ini`

metadata files to reading them from existing TestExpectation lines and

`*-expected.txt`. This is done by patching `testloader.TestLoader`,

which generates (approximately) equivalent `.ini` syntax trees entirely

in memory, at runtime.



To support [1], errors messages in baselines are also loaded into

`expected-fail-message` keys to be checked wptrunner-side by

Chrome-specific executors.



Also, remove the `(INTERNAL|EXTERNAL)-*` wptrunner statuses, as `mozlog`

will refuse to log them [2].



[1]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/rfcs/pull/165

[2]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/59cd10c8/tools/third_party_modified/mozlog/mozlog/logtypes.py#L187-L217



Bug: 1482887, 1481730

displays.

entry.title: [Code Health] Remove uses of base::SupportsWeakPtr
entry.content:
This CL removes uses of this deprecated base class by adding a

base::WeakPtrFactory data member.



In some cases, the base class was no longer being used, so it's

simply removed.



In some cases, it was being used as the base class for a supposed

interface class. In those cases, a pure virtual member function

was added so that implementation classes can have a WeakPtrFactory

data member and dispense appropriate WeakPtr instances.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=bmgordon@chromium.org

entry.title: [ios] Fix crash when Default Search engine observer fires on NTP load
entry.content:
It appears there is a race condition where the default search engine

observer can fire after the feed header VC has been instantiated, but

before its view has been loaded. In that case, we should return early

since the view will be configured to reflect the search engine setting

when it finally does load.

entry.title: [Extensions] Fix a register/unregister bug in dynamic content scripts
entry.content:
If an extension unregisters a script that's pending registration

(such as an immediate `unregister` call following a `register call),

the script should be properly unregistered and not added to the list

of scripts.



We did this half-right: we didn't add it to the list of scripts in

ExtensionUserScriptLoader, but erroneously still added the script to

UserScriptLoader's set, so even though it didn't show up in the list

of registered scripts retrieved from the API (and wouldn't be

persisted), it did still inject.



Fix this and add a regression test.



Bug: 1496907

Change-Id: I44738a04d573957b368a543d6689b6436581e631

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4984804

entry.title: [Autofill] Add TextReplacement parameter to ApplyFieldAction()
entry.content:
This CL adds a new parameter to ApplyFieldAction()* that specifies

whether all text should be replaced or only selected text should

be replaced. The usual Autofill behaviour is to replace all text.



The alternatives to adding a new parameter are:

- Add a member to FormFieldData. Rejected because this member would

be meaningful only for single-field filling (ApplyFieldAction())

but not multi-field filling (ApplyFormAction()) because at most

one field at a time can have selected text.

- Add an enum value to ActionPersistence (currently: kPreview, kFill).

Rejected because contrasting kPreview and kFill with a new value

kReplaceSelection doesn't make sense; after all, replacing selected

text is previewable, too (at least theoretically). Also,

ApplyFormAction() would need to handle the new AutofillPersistence

value.

- Add an enum value to ActionType (currently: kUndo, kFill).

Rejected because ApplyFormAction(ActionType::kReplaceSelection, ...)

wouldn't make sense since at most one field at a time can have

selected text.



The actual replacement of a selection is implemented in a followup

CL.



*: Formerly known as {Preview,Fill}FieldWithValue().



Bug: 1490373, 1484810

Change-Id: I0c87be3cee383ba3bf89cdc734ec19875ae977bc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4974556

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Create mojo interface for RequestConnectionV3
entry.content:
Context/Design: go/cros-nearby-presence-np-nc-interop



This CL creates the RequestConnectionV3 function in

nearby_connections.mojom. This function operates similarly as the

RequestConnection function but to be used by Nearby Presence. Instead

of passing in the endpoint ID and info we are instead passing a

NearbyDevice (see design). A follow-up CL will use this new

functionality in the NearbyConnectionsManager.



Low-Coverage-Reason: OTHER ConnectionListenerV3 was introduced and only

has coverage for initiated_cb. Future CLs that implement

Accept/RejectConnectionV3, DisconnectFromDeviceV3, and

BandwidthUpgradeInitiatedV3 will have additional tests that provide

coverage for the rest of the listener.



Test: unit tests added

Bug: b/287336280, b/307319934

entry.title: Add VRR availability flag
entry.content:
This change adds a ui base feature flag, VariableRefreshRateAvailable,

for indicating whether the variable refresh rate feature is available

on the device. The flag will be set from the chromeos configuration

file for devices which are participating in the VRR experiment study.

The flag is not exposed via chrome://flags.



This change also adds a parameter to the EnableVariableRefreshRate

feature flag which determines whether the availability flag should be

ignored. The parameter defaults to true so that users who override the

VRR setting from chrome://flags can use it freely. Experimental groups

in the Finch study will obey the availability setting as intended.



Bug: b:302547818

entry.title: [iOS] Add IPH animation view for side swipe
entry.content:
View component for side swipe IPH is implemented in this CL. To see how

it will work in production, please see the screenshot

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4m7SQL2YEKF69CP



Usage is demonstraged in ios/showcase/bubble/sc_side_swipe_bubble_view_

controller.mm. If any view or view controller needs this component, they

should initialize it with the frame of the view's initial position, add

it to the view hierarchy and adjust view constraints so its initial view

is visible, then call `startAnimation` or `startAnimationWithDelay` so

the view animates.



Follow up CLs will be created to

1. Handle reduced motion

2. Support orientation change and width change (iPad split screen)

3. Add it for pull-to-refresh and incognito swipe



Bug: 1467874

entry.title: [Extensions] Update service worker contexts when bindings update
entry.content:
Extension bindings can update when permissions or state change,

including different extensions being added, developer mode changing,

or other situations. Currently, when we update "all" bindings, we don't

update service worker bindings. This is incorrect, and breaks developer

mode-restricted APIs.



Fix this by properly updating service worker bindings when bindings

update. Add tests to verify it.



Bug: 986416, 1267489

entry.title: Use distinct methods for policy rules in sandbox
entry.content:
The sandbox library on Windows includes a complex rules engine to

allow proxied functions to evaluate their arguments. Details of

this engine leak out of the sandbox interface via the AddRule()

method which allows specification of a subsystem and semantics.



In practice only four actions are currently supported: allowing

access to files or pipes, allowing Dlls to load under CIG and

setting up GDI hooks for Win32 lockdown.



This CL removes the generic AddRule method from sandbox_policy.h

and replaces it with several more-specific functions, allowing

deletion of the SubSystem enum. This should allow for simplification

of the internals of the rules-engine without exposing these

changes to the rest of Chromium.



No functional changes.



Bug: 1023583

Change-Id: Ia14fdd4913345ac00711a44d5efb3e753d07260f
